results.title: Assassins d'eau douce (TEFC)
results.creator_credit: Comptoir Francais du Film Documentaire and Jean Painleve
results.brief_description: A study of the life of carnivorous freshwater larvae, with interesting jazz background music. Commentary in French. Was awarded the first prize in its section at the 1947 Brussels Film Festival.

results.title: Assassination at Sarajevo: pretext for war
results.creator_credit: CBS News, John Sharnik and Isaac Kleinerman
results.brief_description: This film discusses how the chain of events following the death of Archduke Franz Ferdinand in Serbia, allowed Austria to seek revenge and precipitate the outbreak of World War I. Suitable for Upper Secondary-Tertiatry students.
results.creator_credit_for_label: CBS News, John Sharnik and Isaac Kleinerman

results.title: Assassin of youth
results.creator_credit: B C M Productions, Leo McCarthy and Elmer Clifton
results.brief_description: Joan is a good-natured teenager who, along with her sister, is set to receive her grandmother’s inheritance. When her grandmother is run over by a driver under the influence of marijuana, a reporter is sent to investigate. Meanwhile Joan’s scheming cousin Linda, intent on receiving the money herself, determines to have Joan dis-inherited by ruining her clean-cut reputation. The reporter on the case, who has fallen for Joan, discovers that Linda is a drug peddler and that Joan’s sister has become addicted to marijuana. “Assassin of youth” is an anti-drug teen propaganda movie typical of the 1930s. A fairly stilted and straightforward morality drama, this film has an almost transparent agenda, is patriarchal, traditionalist and simplistic in its politics. Nevertheless the film is a curiosity that is telling about the values of the era and perceived threat that teenagers under the influence posed to the status quo. Cast includes Luana Walters, Arthur Gardner, Fay McKenzie, Michael Owen, Dorothy Short, Dorothy Vaughan, Earl Dwire.

results.title: Assam: where mighty Brahmaputra flows
results.brief_description: Assam is a land of rivers and mountains, famed for its natural beauty. Its industries are sericulture as a cottage industry; metal as a flourishing craft; teas as an important source of foreign exchange; the Digboi Oil Refinery, as the only one of its kind in India; and jute, a very vital product. This is an exotic insight into some of Assam’s cultural aspects by focussing on social behaviour and virtue. Also depicts the fine river, Brahmaputra.

results.title: Asphalt Lake
results.creator_credit: Gaumont-British Instructional and A. Frank Bundy
results.brief_description: After giving examples of the everyday uses of asphalt for road-makling and roofing, this film shows the position of Pitch Lake at La Brea, Trinidad on a large-scale map. Details the work carried out at the lakeside, and in the refineries.

results.title: Askja on fire: volcanic eruption in Iceland 1961
results.brief_description: Shows the massive eruption of the volcano Askja in the central highlands of Iceland in 1961. Presents contrasting scenes of the glowing molten lava against a background of snow and ice. Narrated by Brian D. Holt. Suitable for middle and upper primary levels.

results.title: Ask an Australian about the outdoors [Turkish version]
results.creator_credit: Artransa Park Studios and Kay Roberts
results.brief_description: A family setting out on a picnic prepare by taking adequate food, water and first aid equipment. The danger of fire in the bush is emphasised, and the film also stresses the need to protect the fauna. Note: In Turkish.
